results.title: Outback patrol
results.creator_credit: Lee Robinson, Stanley Hawes and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: An insight into the life of Constable Robert Darken of the Northern Territory Police Force. Every mid-summer, Constable Darken leaves home for a two to three month turn-around of his beat, several thousand square miles of rugged and barren country of the Territory. Here, he inspects cattle, water towers, mines, registers births and marriages, even acts as postmaster, duties which are a far cry from the usual conception of police duties.

results.title: Out shopping
results.creator_credit: Eric Marquis, Ronald H. Riley and R.H.R. Productions
results.brief_description: Two housewives go out on a morning’s shopping. Newly married Mrs A does it unthinkingly; mature Mrs B with dkill. The two meet and Mrs A learns some useful tips. Consumer instructional film successfully using a comedy approach avoiding offence to put across the positive message that shopping must be done carefully.

results.title: Out of the mouths (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Bernice Rubens, Document Productions and Oral Hygiene Service
results.brief_description: An unscripted film shot mainly in a Dorset primary school where an older pupil project on dental health is in progress. It includes discussion during a meeting of the parent/teacher association.

results.title: Out of the forest

results.title: Out of the dark
results.creator_credit: John Drust, Frank A. Hoare, British Electrical Development Association and Merton Park
results.brief_description: A record of the human struggle to bring the light of day into the darkness of night. Dr Arthur Bryant traces the early history of lighting from the open fire to the candle lit by tinder or flint. Professor Andrade continues the story, recalling the early association of the Royal Institution with many of the inventions of the 19th century, describing in turn the gas lamp, the oil lamp, the electric arc, the carbon filament lamp, the gas mantle and the fluorescent tube. The film concludes with examples of the many important everyday activities that artificial lighting has made possible.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Drust, Frank A. Hoare, British Electrical Development Association and Merton Park

results.title: Out of Sight Peace of Mind
results.creator_credit: Brian Hill and A. Stuart Campbell
results.brief_description: Yachts, motor cruisers, fishing vessels and merchant ships that rely on HF radio will soon be covered by a new safety net; the Global Maritime Distress and Safety System, which will combine the latest satellite technology with a number of new HF communications frequencies. The system will be introduced in Australia on 1 July 1991, and it’s vital that offshore mariners become familiar with the changes and the new HF frequencies.

results.title: Out of orbit
results.creator_credit: Jam Handy and Michigan State Board of Alcoholism
results.brief_description: A dramatised case study of the effect of an alcoholic in the family. A boy’s 12th birthday is twisted from a happy occasion to one of despair because his father is an alcoholic. Discusses alcoholism as an illness and suggests ways in which an alcoholic can be helped by clergy, physicians, social workers, public health nurses and the general public.
